## General Principles

- Be concise and clear in your instructions.
- Use bullet points or numbered lists for steps when appropriate.
- Include code snippets in triple backticks for better readability.
- Write code that is **readable, maintainable, and well-structured**.
- Follow the project's coding conventions and best practices.
- I use comments to explain complex logic or decisions in the code.


## Project context

This project is a Funko companion app to help track your collection. You can add, edit, and remove Funkos from your collection, as well as view details about each Funko. The app is built using React Native and Expo for cross-platform compatibility. The main features include:

- Adding new Funkos to your collection with details like name, series, and condition.
- Editing existing Funkos to update their information.
- Removing Funkos from your collection when you no longer own them.
- Viewing details about each Funko.

## Stack 

- React Native
- Expo
- TypeScript
- React Navigation
- TanStack Query
- expo-router
- expo-sqlite
- expo-file-system


## Testing

    We use Jest for unit testing and Playwright for end-to-end testing.
